com.vector.cfg.automation.scripting.api

Interface IScriptCreationApi.IScriptTaskBuilder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IScriptCreationApi.IApplicationScriptTaskBuilder, IScriptCreationApi.IProjectScriptTaskBuilder
    Enclosing interface:
    IScriptCreationApi

    @PublishedApi(value=ADDITIONS_ALLOWED)
 @PublishedApiDomain(value=AUTOMATION_IF)
public static interface IScriptCreationApi.IScriptTaskBuilder
    The IScriptCreationApi.IScriptTaskBuilder provides the methods callable during creation of an IScriptTask.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • isExecutableIf

        @PublishedMethod
IScriptCreationApi.IScriptTaskBuilder isExecutableIf(@DelegatesTo(value=IScriptCreationApi.IScriptExecutionContextWithNotExecutableReasons.class,strategy=1)
                                                                       groovy.lang.Closure<?> isExecutable)
        Sets the isExecutable Closure, which is called before the IScriptTask is executed.
        You can set an isExecutableIf handler, which is called before the IScriptTask is executed. The code can evaluate, if the IScriptTask shall be executable. If the handler returns true, the code of the IScriptTask is executable, otherwise false. See class INotExecutableReasonBuilder.IExecutableTaskEvaluator for details.

        The Closure isExecutable has to return a boolean. The passed arguments to the closure are the same as the code{ } block arguments.

        Inside of the Closure a property notExecutableReasons is available to set reasons why it is not executable. It is highly recommended to set reasons, when the Closure returns false.

        Parameters:
        isExecutable - the code which is executed to evaluate the execution state.
        Returns:
        this builder
        See Also:
        INotExecutableReasonBuilder.IExecutableTaskEvaluator

      • isExecutableIf

        @PublishedMethod
IScriptCreationApi.IScriptTaskBuilder isExecutableIf(INotExecutableReasonBuilder.IExecutableTaskEvaluator isExecutable)
        Sets the INotExecutableReasonBuilder.IExecutableTaskEvaluator, which is called before the IScriptTask is executed.

        See isExecutableIf(Closure) for usage details.

        This method is mainly for Java clients.

        Parameters:
        isExecutable - the INotExecutableReasonBuilder.IExecutableTaskEvaluator instance
        Returns:
        this builder
        See Also:
        INotExecutableReasonBuilder.IExecutableTaskEvaluator

      • newUserDefinedArgument

        @PublishedMethod
<T> IScriptTaskUserDefinedArgument<T> newUserDefinedArgument(java.lang.String argumentName,
                                                                               java.lang.Class<T> valueType,
                                                                               java.lang.String help)
        Create a new IScriptTaskUserDefinedArgument, with the name argument name. The argument does not have a default value, so it is an required argument. To create an optional argument use newUserDefinedArgument(String, Class, Object, String).

        See newUserDefinedArgument(String, Class, Object, String) for usage details.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic type of the argument value type
        Parameters:
        argumentName - the argument name
        valueType - the value type of the argument
        help - the help text display to the user in the script task help
        Returns:
        this builder
        See Also:
        IScriptTaskUserDefinedArgument

      • newUserDefinedArgument

        @PublishedMethod
<T> IScriptTaskUserDefinedArgument<T> newUserDefinedArgument(java.lang.String argumentName,
                                                                               java.lang.Class<T> valueType,
                                                                               @Nullable
                                                                               T defaultValue,
                                                                               java.lang.String help)
        Create a new IScriptTaskUserDefinedArgument, with the name argument name. The argument have a default value, so it is an optional argument. To create an required argument use newUserDefinedArgument(String, Class, String).
        A script task can create IScriptTaskUserDefinedArgument, which can be set by the user (e.g. from the commandline) to pass user defined arguments to the script task execution. An argument can be optional or required. The arguments are type safe and checked before the task is executed.

        Possible valueTypes are:

        • String
        • Boolean
        • Void: For parameter where only the existence is relevant.
        • File: The existence of the file is checked. To reference non existing paths use String instead.
        • Path: Same as File
        • Integer
        • Long
        • Double

        The help text is automatically expanded with the help for user defined script task arguments.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic type of the argument value type
        Parameters:
        argumentName - the argument name
        valueType - the value type of the argument
        defaultValue - the default value of the argument, if it is not set by the user.
        help - the help text display to the user in the script task help
        Returns:
        this builder
        See Also:
        IScriptTaskUserDefinedArgument

      • taskDescription

        @PublishedMethod
IScriptCreationApi.IScriptTaskBuilder taskDescription(java.lang.String description)
        Sets the task description of the script task.
        Task Description
        A script task can have an optional description text. The description shall help the user of the script task to understand what the task does. The method taskDescription(String) sets the description of the script task.

        The description shall be a short overview. The String can be multiline.

        Parameters:
        description - the description text for the script task
        Returns:
        this builder

      • taskHelp

        @PublishedMethod
IScriptCreationApi.IScriptTaskBuilder taskHelp(java.lang.String helpText)
        Sets the task help text of the script tasks.
        Task Help
        A script task can also have an optional help text. The help text shall describe in detail what the task does and when it could be executed. The method taskHelp(String) sets the help of the script task.

        The help shall be elaborate text about what the task does and how to use it. The String can be multiline.

        The help text is automatically expanded with the help for user defined script task arguments, see newUserDefinedArgument(String, Class, String).

        Parameters:
        helpText - the help text for the script task
        Returns:
        this builder
